author: Phuti Mathobela
title: 'Papa G, we had many plans together' | Daily Sun
text: LEGENDARY Darlington "Papa G" Michaels has been remembered as a loving man! The former Isidingo actor was remembered by family and industry friends as they celebrated his life at the Soweto Theatre on Thursday afternoon, 19 September. Darlington Michaels, whose real name was Teboho Ndarana, died after a short illness at the age of 78 on Friday, 13 September. Xoli Noah, the family spokesman, said he worked with Darlington for many years. He mentioned that when Darlington died, they were already working on a couple of projects under his brand. "We were planning many things together, and we lost him just like that. I don't want to lie; I'm hurt and wish he was here," he said. Xoli said Darlington was always happy to be back on his feet. Karabo Ndarana, his granddaughter, said she wanted to see her grandfather grow with her. She expressed her deep sorrow, saying she wanted him to see her success. ALSO READ: [Touching memorial for Mfundisi Ntshebe](https://www.snl24.com/dailysun/celebs/actor-and-musician-philani-aka-mfundisi-ntshebe-remembered-at-memorial-in-katlehong-20240919) "I wanted him to see me going to school and graduating. He owes me a lot as we were so close," she said. Karabo hoped he would be there for her first car and other celebrations. Jerry Tsie said the industry has lost a strong candidate who was full of life. He mentioned that Darlington always wanted to see people happy. "We are saddened by his passing and wish we could do more. We will offer the family a few cultural things just to thank them," he said. Jerry gave the family a traditional stick, mats, and a few other items. Actor Peter Sephuma said Darlington was his biggest industry friend. He mentioned that they worked on several projects together and were planning to bring more great things for TV lovers. "We were close, and we loved one another so much. I will always remember him for all the great things we had together," he said. Actress Tina Jaxa said she was touched by his death as they always communicated daily. She mentioned that she was there when he wasn't feeling well. "I was hurt as he wasn't feeling okay, and I was with him. I will always cherish the moments we had together as a family," she said. Sello Maake KaNcube described Darlington as one of the greatest performers of all time. He said he witnessed Darlington's wonderful work. "He was so brilliant and loved his work. However, he never wanted to be remembered for what he was good at and his artistic work." Darlington's funeral service will be on Saturday, 21 September. The service will be at Uncle Tom's Community Hall in Orlando, Soweto, from 9am, and his body will be laid to rest at the West Park Cemetery in Joburg.
